column4: So, does anyone have any guesses about why my dell is giving me a completely black screen when I first boot my new xubuntu gutsy installation?  Goes black right after grub.
xorg.conf only has those three lines, but it's using generic rather than the ATI drivers
then you need to run " sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg " and select the ati driver
have a guess as to whether a standard american dell laptop keyboard would be a pc101 or pc104?  I'm thinking 104 for the presence of the windows key.
it should give an option already on the line - but go for 104
It listed 105, which is why I questioned it.  105 was specified to be good for Europeans, and mentioned having keys for "< >"
short of counting the keys don't know what else to say...
reconfig finished, still black.  Trying the link you suggested again, to see if the extra lines showed up.
still black.  I'm officially confused.  Any other suggestions for my dive into the world of googling?
there is a generic driver - vesa - dpkg-reconfigure again and select that as the driver
then try google - us dell and ubuntu gutsy
